monogr.title: VVestward for smelts. Or, the vvater-mans fare of mad-merry vvestern wenches : whose tongues albeit like bell-clappers, they neuer leaue ringing, yet their tales are svveet, and will much content you. VVriten by Kinde Kit of Kingstone
monogr.author: Kinde Kit of Kingstone

div.head: TO THE READER.
div.p: READER, for thy pleasure haue I (this once) left my Oare and Stretcher, and stretched my wit, to set downe the honest mirth of my merry Fare Fishwiues: if I haue pleased thee, I am fully contented, and aske no more for my Fare: if not, I haue lost both my labour, and the reward I hoped for from thee, and doe vow neuer more to trouble you with any other words than, Will you haue a paire of Oares? But my hopes are better, cause you (looking at my hands) for no other then Fresh-water Poetry, shall not be deceiued: and therefore not offended. So without any fawning tricks (which are things vsed too much in these times) I take my leaue, wishing thee health; and if thou sit hard, my Boats Cushions. Farewell.

closer.signed: Yours to command, Kinde Kit of Kingstone.
